title: 114_s1527
content: The Act is titled the "Improving Department of State Oversight Act of 2015". It grants competitive hiring status to former employees of the Special Inspector General for Iraq Reconstruction who completed at least 12 months of service before October 5, 2013. Additionally, it ensures the independence of IT systems. SEC. 3. ASSURANCE OF INDEPENDENCE OF IT SYSTEMS. The Secretary of State, with the concurrence of the Inspector General, must certify to congressional committees efforts to ensure integrity and independence of IT systems. SEC. 4. PROTECTING THE INTEGRITY OF INTERNAL INVESTIGATIONS. Section 209(c)(5) of the Foreign Service Act of 1980 is amended to require each entity of the Department of State to report allegations of waste, fraud, abuse, criminal misconduct, or serious misconduct by Department employees to the Inspector General within five business days. The Foreign Service Act of 1980 is amended to require reporting of misconduct by Department employees to the Inspector General within five days, including criminal and serious noncriminal misconduct by authorized individuals. Inspector general has the authority to investigate. The Inspector General has the authority to investigate matters covered by clause (i) and no entity in the Department of State with concurrent jurisdiction can initiate an investigation without reporting allegations to the Inspector General first. The Inspector General in the Department of State must fully cooperate with investigations, providing data, coordinating investigations, and sharing records upon request. The Inspector General in the Department of State must cooperate with oversight and investigative responsibilities by providing requested support. Exceptions and exigent circumstances may allow for dispensing with certain requirements. The Inspector General in the Department of State must cooperate with oversight and investigative responsibilities by providing requested support. Exceptions and exigent circumstances may allow for dispensing with certain requirements related to imminent threats or critical evidence. Nothing in this provision affects the Inspector General's duties or authority under any law. The Inspector General in the Department of State must cooperate with oversight and investigative responsibilities by providing requested support, even in exigent circumstances. This provision does not affect the Inspector General's duties or authority under any law. SEC. 5. REPORT ON INSPECTOR GENERAL INSPECTION AND AUDITING OF FOREIGN SERVICE POSTS AND BUREAUS AND OPERATING UNITS DEPARTMENT OF STATE. The Secretary of State must submit a report to Congress within 180 days of the enactment of this Act regarding the inspection and audit requirements for Foreign Service posts and Department of State operations. The report will evaluate the possibility of implementing a multi-tier system for inspections based on risk levels, including security risks, as determined by the Inspector General. The report will include separate sections prepared by the Inspector General. The report to Congress will include sections prepared by the Inspector General of the Department of State and the Comptroller General of the United States.
